FuncDef:
The mask alarm-name command enables a device to filter out a specific alarm.
The undo mask alarm-name command disables a device from filtering out a specific alarm.
By default, alarms are not masked.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an alarm. This alarm must exist.
The name is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
When quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can create an alarm filtering table and run the mask alarm-name command to define the alarms that users are not concerned about in this table, preventing these alarms from being reported.
Prerequisites
The alarm filtering table exists.
Configuration Impact
The mask alarm-name command can be repeatedly run to filter out multiple alarms.
